name: Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath
description: In the name of Kane! The Command & Conquer™ series continues to thrive with Command & Conquer™ 3: Kane’s Wrath. As the expansion pack to the critically-acclaimed and fan favorite, Command & Conquer 3 Tiberium Wars™, this Real-time Strategy (RTS) game returns to the Tiberium Universe with Kane at the center of an epic new...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista (64-bit not supported) Processor: 2GHz (2.2GHz Vista) Memory: 512 MB (1GB Vista) Graphics: nVIDIA GeForce 4, ATI Radeon 8500 or greater (ATI Radeon 9200 and 9250 PCI, nVIDIA Geforce 4 MX cards not supported.); for Vista NVIDIA GeForce 6100 or ATI Radeon 9500 or greater DirectX®: DirectX 9.0 compatible Hard Drive: 6GB of free space Sound: DirectX 9.0 compatible Controller Support: Keyboard, mouse, optional controller (Xbox 360® Controller for Windows) INTERNET CONNECTION, ONLINE AUTHENTICATION AND ACCEPTANCE OF END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT REQUIRED TO PLAY. TO ACCESS ONLINE FEATURES, YOU MUST REGISTER ONLINE. ONLY ONE REGISTRATION IS AVAILABLE PER GAME. EA ONLINE TERMS & CONDITIONS AND FEATURE UPDATES CAN BE FOUND AT <a href="https://steamcommunity.com/linkfilter/?url=http://WWW.EA.COM" target="_blank" rel="noopener"  >WWW.EA.COM. YOU MUST BE 13+ TO REGISTER WITH EA ONLINE. EA MAY RETIRE ONLINE FEATURES AFTER 30 DAYS NOTICE POSTED ON <a href="https://steamcommunity.com/linkfilter/?url=http://WWW.EA.COM" target="_blank" rel="noopener"  >WWW.EA.COM.

reviews.review_text: Kane Lives!  What else could I say? Classic RTS with great an atmosphere of doomed planet infested by a tiberium. And of course Joseph D. Kucan as charismatic Kane. Last game from a CNC series worth playing.   PS: RIP Westwood.
Best strategy game ever, I belive its better than the 4th kane's wrath defanitly a must have.
The best CNC game going, sunk so much time with online play.
Best strategy game i have played so far
The last good C&C maybe the best ever.  ♥♥♥♥ EA!

In my own opinion it is the best command and conquer for its era.   The races are a bit tacky and slightly pulled from other strategy games.  However the gameplay blends Tiberian sun style mechanics with abilities on units and exicitng super powers with the huge screen filling battles reminicant of Red Alert 1.  If you are a command and conquer fan I reccomend kanes wrath to you.

Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath is the expansion pack of Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars that you need the main game first to play this game.  The game has a 13 missions Nod campaign that brings you to the three timelines, or 'acts' 1st act: After the events of Firestorm Crisis (C&C Tiberian Sun Firestorm) that tells you how Nod has risen again.  2nd act: In the events of Third Tiberium War (C&C3: Tiberium Wars). 3rd act: After the events of Third Tiberium War. This game will tells you more clearly about 3rd Tiberium War as I said above. You will play as LEGION, The succedor of CABAL created by Kane to give you orders.  Pros: -6 new sub-factions to play in skirmish, 2 each for main factions: Steel Talons and ZOCOM for GDI, Black Hand and Marked of Kane for Nod, Reaper-17 and Traveler-59 for Scrin. -New epic unit for use. -Story to additional explain the story in the main game. -New units for all factions.  Cons: -There are no GDI and Scrin Campaign -Shorter campaign playtime due to the fact that this game has only Nod campaign. -There is no online because of GameSpy shutdown. You need  C&C Online  [cnc-online.net]  to play online (Note: This website can also use for the main game, C&C Red Alert 3, C&C Generals and it's expansion Zero Hour too!)   If you ask does this game worth it? I can say: It does.
It definitely brings back my childhood memories when playing this game. #PEACETHROUGHPOWER. Nuff said.

My friend recommended this game for me, i have a rather average laptop, but this game works a charm! (other than when someone drops a huge bomb, then everyone lags :P ) but definately worth a buy if you enjoy fast paced, teeth baring strategy games that keep you on the edge of your seat!
no words but one: BUYTHED...GAME!!!!!

if you like strategy games, this is a must have. its not as complex as other games in this genre and a lot of fun.  the graphics are nice, the sounds as well. videosequences during the campain are really cool.   this is the add on for command&conquer 3 and in my opinion the best c&c game. since the patch 1.2 well balanced and its even fun to play against the AI.    i suggest to buy it only if you have a fast system, otherwise you will have a bad lag in games with a lot of units.
Just rts goodness there is no rts game this good no matter what the price

A proper expansion to the already awesome Tiberium Wars. Definitely pick this up, and going back to TW after KW really feels limiting without the new upgrades, units, and faction that this expansion brings. Seriously you cannot get TW without KW.
Fun to play, a joy to watch

The only and least acceptable C&C Tiberium title made by EA LA. It has delivered moderately fun, offers the new fancy race SCRIN to try out and comes with each race +3 subfractions for different tactics with each different advantages and disadvantages. The graphics are more than good, sound design is very good too, but about the story i am not sure to agree with. What i especially dislike is the build-in badwords filter. Also the skirmish map's are almost all symmetric, which is not impressing me a little. This one also lacks of many skirmish options!!!  Westwood Studios have done far better work than EA LA did and will be remembered, honored and mourned for every TRUE C&C Fan.

Looking back I decided to return and play Command & Conquer again. Lo and behold it was also on sale!! However these games no longer work online so you cannot play with your friends. Its not Steam's fault but it simply doesn't work on the new windows platforms. RIP C&C....
Very enjoyable part of the Command and Conquer line. The addtion of Epic level units really change up the battles
A compilation of everything Westwood innovated before the company's tragic demise. A work of art representing the last of a species of a still dying genre.  Peace through power!
i love the cnc games.so many ways to bring the pain :) !. kane,s rath rocks :)..
Amazing game but ♥♥♥♥ EA AND THERE BULL ♥♥♥♥!!!

I'm going to go ahead and review both C&C 3: Tiberium Wars and Kane's Wrath here, with Kane's Wrath essentially being an expanded version of the base game. If you've played the C&C series before, you won't find it hard to get into the story plot being presented, included with your all time favortie Joe Kucan as Kane, forever and always. Despite Electronics Arts beating the canon pretty hard, Kane is enough to usually keep me playing for a bit.  The actual format of the game itself is pretty simple enough, sticking to the basics, you control your MCV, which acts as your headquarters and main building unit, thus losing one early game usually spells defeat. Much of the combat is rock paper scissor style, however a combination of units is usually required to mount succesful offensive and defense operations against the enemy. Unit garrison of buildings can provide for some amusing early game attrition warfare, until the game gradually reaches mid-game and late-game, in which the bigger and more ridiculous units make their approach.  Being an old classic, I would recommend this game to most general strategists, however if you're looking for an intense strategy, this might not be what you're looking for.  Kane lives!
It is a quite interesting game. I could play with my friend for a whole night. It is so interesting. Even it was a game in 2008, it still has a stand point now.
C&C games are good but not best, i find these to be time wasters compared to Red Alert 1. I do say this is one of the bests  RIP C&C:RE1

Follow-up review to my C&C3 review.  Yeah it's pretty good. New units, new story to fill the gap between Tiberian Sun and Tiberium Wars, as well as showing Nods movements before and after the Third Tiberium War. Six new factions to screw around as in Skirmish and Multiplayer, each with their own units and upgrades that provide considerable upsides and downsides to the player. I'd say the price could be a little lower but it's not super overpriced. If you enjoyed C&C3 you'll love Kane's Wrath. Buy it.  also 8/10
Good old fashioned RTS.... only with Aliens. OFCOURSE!

As far as quality goes, Kane’s Wrath provides everything a good RTS expansion should have. The Scrin, Nod, and GDI are divided into 3 “sub-factions”, where 2 of the sub-factions have a unique military specialization. The other sub-faction has its default features from Tiberium Wars. Kane’s Wrath provides a ton of additional custom maps for skirmishes and gives the player plenty of extra content to continue enjoying C&C 3.   Overall: 9/10 … AWESOME
Adds even bigger stuff to kill... Worth it!

I'm a huge fan of the Command & Conquer series. I especially liked 3. What comes in terms with Kane's Wrath though.. ehhhh.. they definitely tweaked the gameplay. Gameplay's pretty relentless even on normal.   Still, if you've played C&C 3 and want a little extra, get this. Just for the love of all that is holy do not get C&C 4.
Once I upgraded to Windows 10 this game won't run anymore. It keeps crashing at startup. I don't know if this is just problem with me or if the game isn't compatible with Windows 10.
this game is some of my childhood if more poeple will play i will be happy :)

Biggest waste of ideas i've ever seen  They added so much units, fractions, game mechanics... story... more kane...  This DLC needs Tiberium Wars to start up... but not affect Tiberium wars...sad  all i want is to try these things in normal T.W.  This has only one story lane (NOD's).... i would like to try that recktoneer or whatever it is in normal tib. wars...  Game is awesome but even if that one story line is quite long... after end you will be like ... I WANT MOAR
